titles.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the second half of the year)

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” for the second half of the year (fols. 5ra-198ra) I-1) Mäggabit (fols. 5ra-34rc) I-2) Miyazya (fols. 34va/35ra-57rc) I-3) Gǝnbot (fols. 57ra-86vc) I-4) Säne (fols. 87ra-116rc) I-5) Ḥamle (fols. 116va-159vc) I-6) Näḥase (fols. 160ra-191ra) I-7) Ṗagwǝmen (fols. 192ra-197vc) - Postscript: fol. 197vc - Zä-ʾaqräbku maḫletä... "The song I am offering" (Concluding prayer): fol. 198ra The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns
Addition 1; colophon.

owners.owner: According to Additio 1 Wäldä Mikaʾel is the owner, and his wife is Wälättä Mädḫǝn, his children are Gäbrä Täklä Haymanot, Ǝgziʾ Haräya, and Wälättä Gäbrǝʾel.

dcomments.dcomment: Additio 1 mentions the date 1936 A.M. (= 1943/44 A.D.), therefore the Ms. must antedate this year.

txstates.txstate: Two cuts in the spine were carefully repaired. Holes and tears carefully repaired (e.g., fols. 28, 64, 67, 82, 99, 101, 103, 111, 121, 134, 134a). Fol. 198 is made of two pieces of parchment. Some remnants of endband-stitches are visible on the spine close to the head of the Ms. The spine cover was torn and repaired.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament visible on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: criss-cross, double line fillet, double circle, interlaced line fillet, wave form, x-form).

inks.ink: Black, red (fol. 5-86 strong tangelo, fols. 54-115 strong red, fols. 116-198 moderate rose).

txfolios.txfolio: Several foliation and digitization mistakes: Not digitized: fols. 3, 187. Three fols. that were not foliated have been given the

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – ፩I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – [፪]II(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 13r-19v) – ፫III(8/fols. 20r-27v) – ፬IV(7; s.l.: 1, stub after 7; 2, stub after 7; 3, stub after 7/fols. 28r-34v) - V(10/fols. 35r-44v) - VI(9; s.l.: 2, stub after 7/fols.45r-53v) - VII(8/fols. 54r-61v) – VIII(8/fols. 62r-69v) – IX(8/fols. 70r-76v) – X(8/fols. 77r-84v) – XI(8/fols. 85r-92v) – XII(8/fols. 93r-100v) – XIII(8/fols. 101r-108v) – XIV(8/fols. 109r-116v) – XV(8/fols. 117r-124v) – XVI(8/fols. 125r-132v) – XVII(8/fols. 133r-139v) – XVIII(8/fols. 140r-147v) – XIX(8/fols. 148r-155v) – XX(7; s.l.: 4, stub after 4/fols. 156r-162v) – XXI(8/fols. 163r-170v) – XXII(8/fols. 171r-178v) – XXIII(8/fols. 179r-187v) – XXIV(4/fols. 188r-191v) – XXV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 192r-199v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and Ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1E-1E-1E1E-1E1E/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: neat, regular. Hand b: irregular, mediocre.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a fols. 5r-53v, neat and regular, no ligatures. Hand b fols. 54r-198r, mediocre, very irregular; uses different dividers (nine dot asterisks, etc.); sometimes disregards the ruling lines (s. fol. 65v); words beginning with እግዚ- are usually written with ligature.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; the word sälam; several lines or groups of lines on the incipit page of the months; one or two initial lines of each commemorative notice; elements of punctuation signs (e.g., nine dot asterisks in red and black, separating the commemoration notes and the days); elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Several foliation and digitization mistakes: Not digitized: fol. 3 Three fols. that were not foliated (after fols. 16, 72, 134, respectively) have been given the numbers: 16a, 72a, 134a. - The month Miyazya has two incipit pages fols. 34va and 35ra. The text for the monthly readings starts on fol. 34va but breaks off at the end of the page. The text starts again on fol. 35ra and continues without interruption. - Rhymed postscript on fol. 198vb: ለዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ስንክሳር፡ ዜና፡ መላእክት፡ ትጉሐን፨ ወተዝካረ፡ ነቢያት፡ ቅዱሳን፨ ወሰብከተ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ፍጹማን፨ ወገድለ፡ ሰማዕታት፡ መዋዕይን። ወተዝካረ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ጻድቃን፨ … Written in the same hand as the main text. This postscript is a common constituent part of the Synaxarion, cp. Mss. UM-005, GKM-011, DD-037, MR-037, QSM-007, QS-008, etc.

additional.cont: Fol. 198va: Ownership note
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in a secondary hand, in a simple ornamental frame. The note mentions two churches, Däbrä Maryam and Däbrä Täklä Haymanot. The latter was established during the gäbäz-tenure of priest Gäbrä ʾƎsṭifanos. The name of the owner of the Ms. is Wäldä Mikaʾel, and his wife is Wälättä Mädḫǝn, and his children are Gäbrä Täklä Haymanot, Ǝgziʾ Haräya, Wälättä Gäbrǝʾel. The Ms. was bought with the money of the church in the year of John the Evangelist 1936 A.M. (= 1942/43 A.D.).

extras.extra: - Short sälam-hymns to St. Mary are written in different ink, probably in hand b, in the upper margin on the incipit pages of the monthly readings: fols. 5r, 35r, 87r, 116v, 160v, 192r. The months Gǝnbot (fol. 57r) and Ṗagwǝmen (fol. 192r) remain without sälam-hymn. - The spaces for the name of the donor are not filled in. However, in some spaces a name was erased: fols. 46ra, 52rb, 52vb fols. - Interlinear corrections, especially for hand b: fols. 65rabc, 192rc.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decoraded quire marks on the inner upper corner: fols. 5r, 20r, 28r.

drawing.details: Large unfinished drawing of an angel with a sword in black ink and pencil.
Large unfinished drawing of an angel with a sword in black ink and pencil. Left to his head is a pencil-drawing of a bird.
Large unfinished drawing of a Saint with his hands in benediction sign in black ink and pencil.
Very crude pencil drawing of a Saint with his hands in benediction sign.
Crude schematic representation of the Eucharistic bread and its distribution among the participants of the Liturgy; in red and blue pencil.

frames.frame: 1. Fol. 87r (incipit page of the month Säne): crude coloured (black, red) ornamental band with four lateral pendants; interlaces. 2. Fol. 116v (incipit page of the month Ḥamle): unfinished ornamental band; “grid of dots”.
